alert.note: Alert for Lake (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 3:19PM EST until January 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Additional lake effect snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible in northeast Lake County. * WHERE...Lake County, IN. * WHEN...From 6 PM CST this evening to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions. Areas of blowing and drifting snow also develop late tonight and persist through Friday morning. This will significantly reduce visibility and result in snow covered roads, especially in open areas. The hazardous conditions likely impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The dominant lake effect snow band is expected to remain mainly east of Lake County. If the band ends up further west than currently forecast, heavy snowfall rates in excess of 2 inches per hour could result in a period of dangerous travel conditions in northeast Lake County early Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Illinois, the latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Indiana, the latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1-800-261-7623.
